meta_description: LACMA (Los Angeles County Museum of Art). Largest art museum in the West inspires creativity and dialogue. Connect with cultures from ancient times to the present.
hours_text: ## [Collecting Impressionism at LACMA Exhibition on view through Jan 3, 2027 ](/art/exhibition/collecting-impressionism-lacma)
admission_text:
**Welcome to LACMA!**  
  
Our galleries are open and our outdoors spaces are filled with art, art-making activities for all ages, casual dining, and quiet spots to relax. Enjoy live music with Jazz at LACMA on Fridays from April through October and Latin Sounds on Saturdays throughout summer. Located in the center of Los Angeles, LACMA is here for your inspiration and discovery.  
  
We hope you enjoy your visit!  

* * *

**Construction Update**

Our east campus is currently under construction with our new building for the permanent collection—the David Geffen Galleries. The opening of the David Geffen Galleries is anticipated to be April 2026.

Our west campus is open with exhibitions in BCAM and the Resnick Pavilion, which include artworks from the museum's permanent collection.

[Learn more](https://www.buildinglacma.org/) about LACMA's transformation and construction timeline.

* * *

### Planning Your Visit

**Advance Tickets Available for All Visitors, Including Members**

Walk-up tickets are available, but timeslots do sell out and may not be available. Advance timed-entry tickets are highly recommended.

All visitors, including LACMA members and NexGenLA youth members, may purchase or reserve an advance timed-entry ticket [online](https://www.lacma.org/gettickets) or at the LACMA Ticket Office during regular museum hours, or by calling the LACMA Ticket Office at 323 857-6010, 10 am–5 pm, Monday through Friday. [Learn more.](https://www.lacma.org/tickets)

* * *

accessibility_text:
## Accessibility

**Accessible Drop-off**

The most convenient location to drop off a guest who may have limited mobility is on Wilshire Blvd. and S. Ogden Dr., in front of _Urban Light_ , pending ongoing Metro construction.

**Accessible Parking**

Accessible parking is available in the underground Pritzker Parking Garage off Sixth St. (one block east of Fairfax Ave.). These parking spots are located on P1, adjacent to the elevators. Accessible parking is offered for standard, van, and electric vehicles.

Four spots on P2 of Pritzker Parking Garage near the elevators are reserved for pregnant people and families traveling with small children.

**Accessible Public Transportation**

[Please visit Metro](https://www.metro.net/) for more information.

**Accessible Restrooms**

Every restroom at LACMA is wheelchair accessible. Restrooms are located in the Resnick Pavilion and BCAM Levels 2 and 3.

At this time, LACMA does not offer single-user/family restrooms. Please contact [publicinfo@lacma.org](mailto:publicinfo@lacma.org) to request a special accommodation.

**Wheelchairs at LACMA**

Every gallery, restroom, dining service, and outside space at LACMA is wheelchair accessible. Complimentary wheelchairs are available at the Ticket Office during regular operating hours, first come, first served.

Motorized wheelchairs are welcome.

**Quiet Times to Visit**

The museum is quietest between 1 to 4 pm, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Please note that weekends and holidays can be very crowd...
